an4.57:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Koliyans, where they have a town named Pajjanika.
an4.57:4.2: Then the Buddha got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, went to the home of Suppavāsā the Koliyan,
an4.57:4.3: where he sat on the indicated seat.
an4.57:4.4: Then Suppavāsā served and satisfied the Buddha with her own hands with a variety of delicious foods.
an4.57:4.5: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, she sat down to one side.
an4.57:5.1: “Suppavāsā, when a noble disciple gives food, she gives the recipients four things.
an4.57:5.3: Long life, beauty, happiness, and strength.
an4.57:5.4: Giving long life, she has long life as a god or human.
an4.57:5.5: Giving beauty, she has beauty as a god or human.
an4.57:5.6: Giving happiness, she has happiness as a god or human.
an4.57:5.7: Giving strength, she has strength as a god or human.
an4.57:5.8: When a noble disciple gives food, she gives the recipients these four things.”
an4.57:6.2: pure, fine, and full of flavor,
an4.57:6.3: that offering—given to people of integrity,
an4.57:6.4: who have good conduct, and are big-hearted—
an4.57:6.5: joins merit to merit. It’s very fruitful,
an4.57:6.6: and is praised by those who know the world.
an4.57:7.2: live full of joy in the world.
an4.57:7.3: They’ve driven out the stain of stinginess down to the root,
an4.57:7.4: blameless, they go to a heavenly place.”
